intro: Neooreophilus pilosellus, commonly known as the silky cushion plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and hairy, silver-green foliage that helps reduce water loss. Its flowers are small, typically yellow or white, and appear in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
